title: Elijah Wood Lists Los Angeles Bungalows for Just Under $2M
text:
“Lord of the Rings” star Elijah Wood listed his Los Angeles property for just under $2 million last week, according to property records.



Located on Venice’s Electric Avenue, the property includes two one-bedroom, one-bathroom bungalows, according to Douglas Elliman’s Juliette Hohnen, who has the listing. She was not immediately available for comment.



Mr. Wood, 38, bought the property for $1.2 million in 2004, according to records on PropertyShark. It was listed for $1.995 million on Oct. 13.

More: Larry King Lists Beverly Hills Villa for $16.995 Million

The two cottages combined have about 1,400 square feet of interior space, and offer “the possibility of either a high income-producing duplex or combining to create one amazing single family residence,” according to the listing.



The front bungalow is a Craftsman-style home built in 1921 and fully renovated. Behind its red door is a bright living room with beamed ceilings, cork flooring and wood detailing and built-ins, the listing said. Windows and skylights bring natural light to the cottage, and the bedroom and eat-in kitchen both open onto a deck for outdoor entertaining.



The rear cottage also has a full kitchen, and a living room with painted wood floors, as per the listing. There’s also a dining nook, plus a bathroom with built-in shelving.

More: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen Chop More Than $5M Off Boston-Area Home

Both homes are surrounded by gardens, a privacy gate and tall bamboo plants.



The actor, who played Frodo Baggins in the “Lord of the Rings” film trilogy, as well as “The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey,” did not immediately return request for comment.



The property is just off Abbot Kinney Boulevard, where many of Venice’s shopping and dining options can be found, including “hotspots” like Gjelina, Erewhon and the Tasting Kitchen, the listing said. It’s also a short walk to the beach and boardwalk.



Variety originally reported the listing.
